title: why are turrets so useless now
body:
people can dive me and tank like 20 shots and not die its kind of un-fun.

Edit: I have heard rumours that when you are losing lane you sit and farm under turret, I have realized that you can't do that when a liss can't ult you and burst you down while hiding underturret

replies.body: I'd rather have strong turrets and weak minions. These days, you're better hiding among a swarm of minions than you are hugging a turret.
Unless youre playing against a singed with ghost
Or these guys {{champion:82}} {{champion:8}}
That's an oddly specific scenario...
because singed without ghost is a big downfall next to a singed with ghost
Cause then they couldn't keep their shitty lasers if they had other towers being so stronk. Srsly I rather old towers. Fuck those lasers

Now, if the Lasers bounced between minions that would be something else (Because the whole point is seemingly to prevent minion waves from killing inhib towers on their own), but as it stands, it takes it twice as long to kill anything that isn't a siege minion.

The idea they had [here](http://euw.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/gameplay/preseason-2015-diversifying-objectives) was that the lasers would allow people to stop split pushers that were good duelists without having a better duelist.

Well it kind of fails at that, since most of those "good duelists" who would tower dive and then take out the tower kill you before the damage ramps up to any reasonable amount, even through the slow and damage reduction.

I am not going to say that the lasers work well, but they have helped me out in the past.  They could use a buff, but I think the idea of it is you still need someone who is an okay duelist otherwise split pushing would be useless.

I hate how hard the shield turrets got nerfed.  Nerfing them a little was good a probably even healthy for the game to some extent but now it's literally one hit to get rid of the shield. It used to feel like a risk when I had to get in to hit the turret enough to bring down the shield to then weaken their team defenses... now it just feels like an auto attack.  It's so incredibly weak it practically isn't there anymore.

What is even more pathetic is that they STILL feel stronger than the inhib "laser" turrets.  The laser is only really annoying because it seems to leash you for an incredibly long range.  Other than that, it never feels too strong.

Have you played DotA 2? The turrets deal like 70 damage per shot, and the fountain takes like 7 seconds to kill a squishy.

You get like 3 man dived at level 3 if you don't have good cc.
Except in dota 2, towers attack faster, and early on, the amount of hp people have is lower.
they also fire faster, and don't aggro onto heroes unless you auto attack another hero. DotA 2 towers are also balanced around that and generally seem more durable.

They just want assasins and other bursty mid laners to dominate the meta.





But seriously though the turrets should at least have some scaling to the late-game.

Its because the distance turret-to-turret in top-lane is larger than mid-lane, else it'd happen midlane more too. It doesn't happen as often bot-lane because its two people to lock you down under the turret.

What if Inhibitor turrets had shields on them and gave the shields to champions as well, albeit at a smaller amount, and the two news turrets each had a stronger shield, gave the shield to champions, and gave each other a shield. So then the way this could be balanced is that when one nexus turret goes down, the other turret loses the shield that it was given from the second turret. Could this be a nice buff or is it useless? I guess the laser turrets could be given more damage at the start but take a bit longer, maybe 0.2 seconds longer, to get fully wound up.
Shorter games > Strong towers
So, you're suggesting pantheon buffs? I approve.

I agree. I have a basic strategy as yasuo mid, and 90% of the time it gets me first kill in lane when I do it right. It involves poking down the enemy, then hard pushing to turret and hitting 6 first, then diving under turret. If i pull it off, about 95% of the time i get out alive. So yes, i think turrets are very weak, because i see the easiness to tower dive right now. And yes, I'm saying that they need a buff. Maybe not a range buff, but either an attack speed buff or an attack damage buff. Probably attack speed.

I still don't get why they got rid of the mid turret shield, then left a useless amount of shield on the top and bot turrets what is that even for? 2 stray melee minions who made it with in striking range?
I've been killed by a Talon with a tenth of his hp left, and then he walked off 4 tower shots. No tanky items or anything.
Imo the solution is to have turrets do % health (increasing with each hit) rather than a flat amount of damage. Right now tanks don't give a fuck about turrets and just sit under them for a minute.

I feel like the turrets are beings who after being destroyed countless times, don't care about anything anymore, especially the life of a champion. It slowly charges each shot without a worry in the world. If you die trying to fight under it, so what? If it actually manages to help, whoop dee do.

The answer, of course, is to stay out from under your tower with divable or snipable amounts of hp and to lock down any tank who tries to open up the tower and those under it to being attacked. That sad part is, in certain situations ({{champion:238}} {{champion:105}} ), this is easier said than done. Even doing the second thing I mentioned may lead to the tank flashing away while your team is killed under their own tower or the tower is destroyed. 

But tanks are tanks. They might take a lot of shots, but they won't likely do much in a tower dive on their own. Not that standing under a tower for a full blown minute at half build is okay.
